org.flemil.ui
Interface Window

All Superinterfaces:
Item
All Known Implementing Classes:
PopUpWindow, ScreenWindow
public interface Window
extends Item

This Interface represents an Item that represents a Window that can be displayed in the application. A window can have a title, must have a body where the items within the window are shown and must have a menu associated with it that is displayed to the user when this Window is the current Window on top of the application display. The menu bar used to represent the menu does not necessarily have to be associated with this window as is the case for PopupWindow which uses the menu bar provided by its parent.

Author:
Solomon Kariri

Method Summary
 Panel getContentPane()
          Returns the container that is used by this window to add items to its central display regions

          Returns the Menu that is associated with this Window.

          Sets the title for this Window.
 void menuLeftSelected()
          Method that is called when the left item of the menu bar for this window is selected.
 void menuRightSelected()
          Method that is called when the right item of the menu bar for this window is selected.
 void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
          Sets the title for this Window.If the title is long enough not to fit within the available width of the window, the window will scroll the title automatically when it is displayed so that the whole title is readable by the user.

Method Detail

getMenu

Menu getMenu()
Returns the Menu that is associated with this Window. Every Window Must have a Menu associated with it.

Returns:
the Menu that is associated with this Window.

getTitle

java.lang.String getTitle()
Sets the title for this Window. If the title is long enough not to fit within the available width of the window, the window will scroll the title automatically when it is displayed so that the whole title is readable by the user.

Returns:
the title for this Window.

setTitle

void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
Sets the title for this Window.If the title is long enough not to fit within the available width of the window, the window will scroll the title automatically when it is displayed so that the whole title is readable by the user.

Parameters:
title - the title to be used this Window.

getMenuBarRect

Rectangle getMenuBarRect()
Returns the bar Rectangle that is used for displaying this Window's Menu. The bar does not have to belong to this window and it can be the bar for a parent to this window as is the case for PopupWindow

Returns:
the bar Rectangle that is used for displaying this Window's Menu.

menuRightSelected

void menuRightSelected()
Method that is called when the right item of the menu bar for this window is selected. This might be the right soft key or not depending on the current orientation of the application. The window does not need to care about which key it is but should only respond to the fact that the right key for the MenuBar has been selected.

menuLeftSelected

void menuLeftSelected()
Method that is called when the left item of the menu bar for this window is selected. This might be the left soft key or not depending on the current orientation of the application. The window does not need to care about which key it is but should only respond to the fact that the left key for the MenuBar has been selected.

getContentPane

Panel getContentPane()
Returns the container that is used by this window to add items to its central display regions

Returns:
the container that is used by this window to add items to its central display regions
